greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-5) + a(n-3)^2) / a(n-6) with a(0) = a(1) = 1, a(2) = 0, a(3) = -1, a(4) = -3, a(8) = 29.
comment: Similar to the Somos-6 and Somos-7 sequences with many bilinear identities.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..208
formula: a(n) = a(-n) for all n in Z.
a(n) = A256858(2*n) for all n in Z.
Let b(n) = A102276(n). Then 0 = a(n) * b(n) - a(n+2) * b(n-2) + a(n+3) * b(n-3) for all n in Z.
0 = a(n) * a(n+6) - a(n+1) * a(n+5) - a(n+3) * a(n+3) for all n in Z.
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 13 2015
